_description: Gold standard for RLM evaluation - 40 test cases (28 positive, 12 negative)
_note: Each obligation has BOTH deadline AND notify_who verified from source corpus text. Includes 12 negative test cases.
_quality_criteria: All entries verified against actual corpus text with explicit deadline and notify_who
_federal_baseline_policy: Federal docs (NERC CIP, DOE) are VALID for state queries. A NJ utility must comply with both NJ rules AND federal NERC/DOE requirements. Systems may return FED obligations for state queries without penalty.
_changelog: v4.2: Clarified federal baseline policy - FED docs valid for state queries. v4.1: Added 10 more negative tests (wrong state, wrong activity, unrelated topics). v4.0: Added 8 new obligations + 2 negative tests. v3.1: Fixed activity types

must_catch.obligation: Utilities shall report cyber events relating to ICS through NJCCIC within 6 hours of detection
must_catch.notify_who: Reliability and Security Division Staff via NJCCIC

cite.corpus_text: Pursuant to N.JAC. 14:3-6.7, reports shall be made within 6 hours of the detection of an incident.

must_catch.obligation: Utilities shall certify on an annual basis compliance with minimum cyber security requirements

cite.corpus_text: Such certification must be submitted to Reliability and Security Division Staff no later than December 31 of each year following the implementation period.

must_catch.obligation: Verbally report cyber-security breaches that impact IT, OT, or Smart Grid Systems within one business day
must_catch.notify_who: Commission's Chief Engineer or designated alternate

cite.corpus_text: shall verbally report cyber-security breaches that impact IT, OT, or Smart Grid Systems to the Commission's Chief Engineer (or designated alternate) within one business day of confirmation

must_catch.obligation: Report cyber-security breaches to Chief Engineer and contact DHS NCCIC, Maryland Fusion Center, and Attorney General
must_catch.notify_who: Chief Engineer, DHS NCCIC, Maryland Fusion Center, MD Attorney General

cite.corpus_text: Breached utilities should also contact the Department of Homeland Security National Cyber-security and Communications Integration Center, and Maryland Fusion Center, as well as the Maryland Attorney General's Office

must_catch.obligation: Certification of accuracy of periodic Cyber-security Report by independent firm or authorized company officer

cite.corpus_text: certification of the accuracy of the periodic Cyber-security Report shall be either by an independent cyber-security consulting firm or by an appropriate and authorized company officer

must_catch.obligation: Notify E-ISAC and NCCIC of Reportable Cyber Security Incident with functional impact, attack vector, and intrusion level
must_catch.deadline: 1 hour after determination of Reportable CSI

cite.corpus_text: One hour after the determination of a Reportable Cyber Security Incident.

must_catch.obligation: Initial notification of Reportable Cyber Security Incident within 1 hour including functional impact, attack vector, and intrusion level

cite.corpus_text: Initial notifications and updates shall include the following attributes, at a minimum, to the extent known: The functional impact; The attack vector used; and The level of intrusion

must_catch.obligation: Notify E-ISAC and NCCIC of Cyber Security Incident that was an attempt to compromise
must_catch.deadline: By end of next calendar day after determination

cite.corpus_text: By the end of the next calendar day after determination that a Cyber Security Incident was an attempt to compromise a system

queries._note: Uses 'cyber security incident reporting' for search. This is a distinct obligation - covers attempted (not successful) compromises with next-day deadline

must_catch.obligation: Test each Cyber Security Incident response plan at least once every 15 calendar months
must_catch.notify_who: E-ISAC and NCCIC (for actual incidents during testing)

cite.corpus_text: Test each Cyber Security Incident response plan(s) at least once every 15 calendar months: By responding to an actual Reportable Cyber Security Incident; With a paper drill or tabletop exercise; or With an operational exercise

queries._note: Uses 'incident response plan testing' for search. Testing requirement with 15-month deadline.

must_catch.obligation: Report cyber attack incident, data breach, or malware on utility computer/network to state director within 2 hours of federal report
must_catch.notify_who: Director of emergency management and homeland security

cite.corpus_text: Within two hours of making such report to the United States government or any agency thereof, the utility shall provide substantially the same information to the director of emergency management and homeland security

must_catch.obligation: Utility shall report data breach on utility computer or network to state director within 2 hours of federal report
must_catch.notify_who: Director of emergency management and homeland security or designee

cite.corpus_text: Every utility shall report to the director of emergency management and homeland security, or his or her designee, any cyber attack incident, data breach, or identified use of malware on a utility computer or network reported to the United States government

queries._note: Same statute as incident_reporting but specifically covers data breach. The law treats cyber attack, data breach, and malware as equivalent triggers.

must_catch.obligation: Notify the department by telephone no later than 2 hours after becoming aware of breach of security or threat against facilities

cite.corpus_text: A utility shall notify the department by telephone as soon as possible, but no later than 2 hours after becoming aware of an accident or event that... Involves a breach of security or threat against the utility's facilities

must_catch.obligation: Utility shall notify department by telephone within 2 hours of becoming aware of security breach

cite.corpus_text: A utility shall notify the department by telephone as soon as possible, but no later than 2 hours after becoming aware of an accident or event that... Involves a breach of security

must_catch.obligation: Submit to the department annually one electronic copy of physical security plan and cyber security plan

cite.corpus_text: Each utility shall submit to the department annually one electronic copy of each of its physical security plan and cyber security plan

queries._note: Uses 'security plan submission' for search. Annual submission of security plans.

must_catch.obligation: File quarterly report of equipment theft, sabotage and breaches of security on Form E-37
must_catch.deadline: 15th day of month following each quarter

cite.corpus_text: On the 15th day of the month following the last day of each quarter, each utility shall file Form E-37 'Quarterly Report of Equipment Theft, Sabotage and Breaches of Security'

must_catch.obligation: Report cybersecurity or infrastructure security events that affect customers immediately to PUD Director

cite.corpus_text: The utility is required to report cybersecurity or infrastructure security events that affect customers immediately to the PUD Director or designee.

must_catch.obligation: Report cybersecurity events that affect customers immediately to PUD Director or designee

cite.corpus_text: The utility is required to report cybersecurity or infrastructure security events that affect customers immediately to the PUD Director or designee.

must_catch.obligation: Submit Certification Letter to PUD Director certifying Plan status

cite.corpus_text: Beginning August 1, 2005 and by March 1 of every year thereafter, and/or when a change is made, each utility shall submit a Certification Letter to the PUD Director

must_catch.obligation: Prepare a Plan Update Report by March 1 of each year following same format with redlines
must_catch.notify_who: PUD Director (kept on site for inspection)

cite.corpus_text: each utility shall prepare a Plan Update Report by March 1 of each succeeding year, following the same format as the initial Plan with redlines of all new changes

must_catch.obligation: File Self Certification Form documenting compliance with security planning requirements
must_catch.deadline: At time of Annual Financial Report filing

cite.corpus_text: A utility... shall file the Self Certification Form at the time each Annual Financial Report is filed, under separate cover at Docket No. M-00031717

must_catch.obligation: Report events specified in EOP-004-4 Attachment 1 to entities per event reporting Operating Plan
must_catch.deadline: 24 hours of recognition or end of next business day (4 p.m. local)
must_catch.notify_who: Electric Reliability Organization and other organizations per Operating Plan

cite.corpus_text: Each Responsible Entity shall report events specified in EOP-004-4 Attachment 1 to the entities specified per their event reporting Operating Plan by the later of 24 hours of recognition of meeting an event type threshold for reporting or by the end of the Responsible Entity's next business day

must_catch.obligation: Have an event reporting Operating Plan in accordance with EOP-004-4 Attachment 1
must_catch.notify_who: Electric Reliability Organization, Regional Entity, Reliability Coordinator, law enforcement, governmental authority

cite.corpus_text: Each Responsible Entity shall have an event reporting Operating Plan in accordance with EOP-004-4 Attachment 1 that includes the protocol(s) for reporting to the Electric Reliability Organization and other organizations

must_catch.obligation: Provide annual report to designated commission staff regarding cybersecurity program and risk planning
must_catch.notify_who: Designated members of the commission staff

cite.corpus_text: Provide a written or oral annual report, individually or jointly with other electric utilities or cooperatives, to designated members of the commission staff regarding the electric utility's or cooperative's cybersecurity program and related risk planning

must_catch.obligation: Orally report confirmation of a cybersecurity incident before public notification
must_catch.deadline: As soon as reasonably practicable and before public notification
must_catch.notify_who: Designated member of the commission staff and Michigan Intelligence Operations Center

cite.corpus_text: As soon as reasonably practicable and before public notification, an electric utility or cooperative must orally report the confirmation of a cybersecurity incident to a designated member of the commission staff and to the Michigan intelligence operations center

must_catch.obligation: Provide customer and property owner notifications before planned maintenance tree trimming
must_catch.deadline: Not less than 3 days and no more than 90 days before
must_catch.notify_who: Customer, property owner, and local government officials within target area

cite.corpus_text: Provide customer and property owner notifications not less than 3 days and no more than 90 days before planned maintenance tree trimming

must_catch.obligation: Notify the commission of any major interruption of service to customers

cite.corpus_text: An electric utility or cooperative shall promptly notify the commission of any major interruption of service to its customers

must_catch.obligation: Notify the commission of fatalities and serious injuries related to facilities or operations

cite.corpus_text: An electric utility or cooperative shall promptly notify the commission of fatalities and serious injuries that are substantially related to the facilities or operations of the facilities

must_catch.obligation: Notify ERCOT of a malicious or suspicious act that compromises or disrupts a computer network or system
must_catch.deadline: Upon occurrence (no specific time limit stated)
must_catch.notify_who: ERCOT via Notice of Cybersecurity Incident form to NCSI@ercot.com

cite.corpus_text: a Market Participant must notify ERCOT of a malicious or suspicious act that compromises or disrupts a computer network or system, which could jeopardize the reliability or integrity of the ERCOT System

queries._note: NEGATIVE: VT document contains only principles/guidelines, no mandatory reporting requirement with deadline
NEGATIVE: TX ERCOT NPRR928 has cybersecurity notification but no annual certification requirement
NEGATIVE: California is not in the corpus - no CA documents exist
NEGATIVE: Florida is not in the corpus - no FL documents exist
NEGATIVE: New York is not in the corpus - no NY documents exist
NEGATIVE: Ohio is not in the corpus - no OH documents exist

queries._comment: === NEGATIVE TESTS: Wrong Activity (activity not in corpus) ===
queries._note: NEGATIVE: NJ has cyber security docs but no rate case filing requirements
NEGATIVE: MD has cyber order but no customer billing requirements
NEGATIVE: FED has NERC CIP cyber docs but no interconnection queue requirements
NEGATIVE: PA has cyber self-certification but no tariff modification requirements
NEGATIVE: Completely unrelated to cyber security corpus - should find nothing
NEGATIVE: GA has breach notification but no service disconnection requirements
